summary: This document is an internal FBI email chain from October 2020 discussing the logistics of sending invitations and RSVP questionnaires for a victim briefing related to the Epstein case. It involves coordination between the FBI Victim Services Division, the Department of Justice Civil Rights Division (CRT), and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) regarding contacting victims and their attorneys.

persons.name: Bob Josefverg
persons.context: Mentioned as the source from whom the most recent list of clients was obtained, likely related to victim or attorney contact information.

persons.name: E. Stauss
persons.context: Primary correspondent in the email chain, coordinating the invitation process for the victim briefing, discussing contact lists and document revisions.

connections.description: E. Stauss references obtaining a client list from Bob Josefverg, indicating a professional data-sharing relationship for victim outreach.

events.title: Planned Victim Briefing Meeting
events.description: A meeting for victims and their attorneys was scheduled, with invitations being sent out in late October 2020.

keyFacts: The FBI and DOJ were coordinating a victim briefing for November 12, 2020, related to the Epstein case.
Invitations were sent to 14 attorneys (to pass to clients), 6 victims directly, and a family member of a deceased victim.
A master contact list existed, but for many survivors, direct email addresses were not available, and some had multiple attorneys.
The email chain highlights the careful, internal process for victim outreach, including document clearance and data protection protocols.
An email address, Briefing.RsvP@usdoj.gov, was set up specifically for RSVPs to the briefing.
